title: Fundamental Components of Deep Learning: A category-theoretic approach
abstract: arXiv:2403.13001v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Deep learning, despite its remarkable achievements, is still a young field. Like the early stages of many scientific disciplines, it is marked by the discovery of new phenomena, ad-hoc design decisions, and the lack of a uniform and compositional mathematical foundation. From the intricacies of the implementation of backpropagation, through a growing zoo of neural network architectures, to the new and poorly understood phenomena such as double descent, scaling laws or in-context learning, there are few unifying principles in deep learning. This thesis develops a novel mathematical foundation for deep learning based on the language of category theory. We develop a new framework that is a) end-to-end, b) unform, and c) not merely descriptive, but prescriptive, meaning it is amenable to direct implementation in programming languages with sufficient features. translated_title: 深度学习的基本组成部分：一个范畴论方法
translated_abstract: 尽管深度学习取得了显著的成就，但它仍然是一个年轻的领域。类似许多科学学科的早期阶段，它以发现新现象、临时设计决策和缺乏统一和构成性的数学基础为特征。本论文基于范畴理论的语言为深度学习发展了一种新颖的数学基础。我们开发了一个新的框架，它是a)端到端的，b)统一的，c)不仅仅是描述性的，而且是规范性的，这意味着它适用于具有足够功能的编程语言中的直接实现。我们还将许多现有方法系统化，将许多现有构造放置在一起。
tldr: 本论文基于范畴论语言为深度学习发展了新的数学基础，提出了一种端到端、统一且规范性的框架。
en_tdlr: This paper develops a novel mathematical foundation for deep learning based on the language of category theory, and proposes an end-to-end, uniform, and prescriptive framework.
